name: Home @ the Mansion

reviews.text: Good value backpacking accomodation, beds were comfy enough. Major issue I had was the lock on the dorm door didnt really work, you could just open the door by pushing hard, but individual lockers make up for that. Would stay there again, friendly service and suitable facilities. Good value for money
reviews.title: Great choice for backpacking accomodation

reviews.text: I thought this was a great place full of friendly staff and in a great location. I was in a private room initially then in a 4 bedded mixed dorm. Toilet and shower facilities were great and the kitchen and fridge space was ample. I didn't welcome the bed bug bites though from sleeping in the mixed dorm which put a huge dampener on my stay here.
reviews.title: Great on a budget...However...

reviews.text: We stayed at Home @ the Mansion in May 2011. We stayed in a 6 bed dorm - spacious, enough space for luggage sprawling. The bedding they gave was a duvet cover, pillow cover, and sheet - I particularly liked the duvet cover and knowing they didn't reuse blankets!
reviews.title: a very home-y hostel!

reviews.text: It seemed when we were there, there were a lot of long-term live-in's at this hostel - not many staying for a few nights like us. Everyone seemed to have their own group of friends created because they were long-term.
reviews.title: A mansion with characters

reviews.text: It also seemed that because everyone was long -term, they worked, so the hostel became really quiet at like 11pm!! Great for sleeping, not so great for partying.
reviews.title: Friendly and helpful!

reviews.text: The only problem with this hostel is the bedrooms. We were squeezed into a 7 bed dorm, which really was too small for 7 people, and the bunk beds seem to be made out of plastic drinking straws and wobble around like crazy. But the biggest issue is that there are no lockers in the rooms so every inch of carpet and bed is covered in clothes and shoes and the contents of the guests' backpacks.
reviews.title: Definitely recommended

reviews.text: Otherwise this hostel is BRILLIANT! The building itself is very impressive and is right on the route of the free city circle tram. The staff are cheerful and helpful and the kitchen is small but clean and well stocked. The communal areas are fantastic and there are two cubbyholes under the amazing staircase with tv/DVD players so you can sneak off and watch a film if you don't fancy watching whatever is on in the kitchen! All in all we had a great stay and would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hostel, couldn't fault it at all!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights and was really pleased to be walking distance from everything in the CBD. I had a 5 share dorm which was clean and even got a bed that wasn't a bunk! Staff were friendly and facilities were clean and well organized. The building has a lot of character and is architechtually amazing- you might not believe there is a hostel inside!
reviews.title: Really Great Hostel, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to find an extremely nice welsh man greeting us a the front desk and for that matter all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. They were always on hand to show you where to go and what there was to do.
reviews.title: Very Good place to stay!

reviews.text: The hostel itself was very clean and tidy and had a great atmosphere. We stayed in a 4 bed mixed dorm which was clean and comfortable and had a TV.
reviews.title: Best in Melbourne

reviews.text: The downsides were that there was no A/C which was a nightmare in the 40 degree Celsius heat. and the kitchen and it's facilities were not really big enough for the size of the hostel. The wasn't enough fridge space, pans, crockery, or hobs.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hostel in Central Melbourne

reviews.text: All in all though a very good hostel just a few minor adjustments and it would have got a top rating. I would recommend this hostel, we even stayed 4 nights longer than planned.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!! <3

reviews.text: I only initially booked for 3 nights at this hostel but after staying here me and my travel buddy wanted to stay longer, sadly due to high level of bookings we had to stay elsewhere until we there was availability. I'm pleased this happened as it gave me a chance to stay at a cheaper but a much worse hostel and made me appreciate this hostel much more!! Hostel is really friendly with helpful staff, good kitchen and communal areas. Bathrooms (particularly on the 3rd floor) are very spacious and have never needed to wait for a shower (unlike other hostels I've stayed in) at whatever time of the day. Hostel is full of character and the themed nights are a bonus. Lockers were installed during my stay which has improved the security of the building and guests belongings. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone looking to stay in Melbourne and in need of a value-for-money hostel!!
reviews.title: Best hostel in Melourne!!
Great Place
reviews.text: Friendly people, nice place, very quiet, clean, etc

Housed in a former Salvation Army training college, Home @ The Mansion presents an impressive street frontage. At each end two grand staircases provide access to rooms on the upper floors (no lift). The hostel isn't as big as it appears from the outside and has the friendly atmosphere of a smaller hostel.
reviews.title: Funky hostel in impressive building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My dorm room was a little cramped (could have done without the extra single bed crammed in). Due to good weekly rates this hostel is popular with longer term guests who tend to stake a claim over floorspace, however, this could be improved by providing lockers in the rooms.
reviews.title: Great Staff, strange booking system.

reviews.text: Although not long opened, the conversion of the building in to a hostel appears to have been hurried in places and the decor is already starting to deteriorate. Some areas, notably the kitchen, were very well fitted out. There is also no 'standalone' communal room, with just two small TV areas being tucked under the grand staircases.
reviews.title: comfortable

description: Located in a spectacular heritage listed building in Melbourne CBD, Home at The mansion is a backpackers dream! The building may look big but this is a small and friendly hostel with great facilities and a location second to none! We have 4, 5, 6, 7 and 12 bed dorms as well as double rooms. Our facilities include wifi (only $3 per hour, fully equipped kitchen, dvd area, playstation area, large sunny garden, bbq area, free theme nights and tour information and bookings.
